title: Bank of Korea Holds Rate Steady as Expected
sub_head: The Bank of Korea has signaled it will tighten monetary policy to help curb soaring household debt
body:
South Koreaâ€™s central bank on Tuesday kept its base rate unchanged at 0.75% as expected, following a 25 basis point increase in August. Analysts expect it to raise rates again next month.
The Bank of Korea has signaled it will tighten monetary policy to help curb soaring household debt fueled by cheap borrowing costs. Red-hot housing prices and persistent inflation pressure are risks to the economic recovery from the Covid-19 pandemic.
